Description: Shoulder sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lekythos; exterior: on shoulder, bottom part of lotus bud and tendril pattern frieze; below, black-figure decoration consisting of bearded male figure (head with fillet in added red and right arm remaining) to left.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 128, pl. XXXIX, no. 356.2)
Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 233, no. 187)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1926)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4776 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
